alert.note: Alert for Central Washington; Coastal Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 3:17PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Washington County through 415 PM EDT... At 316 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Princeton, or 18 miles west of Calais, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Calais, Perry, Princeton, Meddybemps, Grand Lake Stream, Baileyville, Robbinston, Alexander, Charlotte, Baring, Cooper, Crawford and Big Lake. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 near Princeton. State Highway 9 between Crawford and Baring. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
